title: First Step
text: First, multiply each entry of row $$2$$ by $$-2$$. The result is $$\begin{bmatrix} 6 & -4 & 3 \\ -6 & 4 & -2 \end{bmatrix}$$
speech: First, multiply each entry of row  2  by  negative 2 . The result is  the 2 by 3 matrix row 1 6, negative 4, 3 row 2 negative 6, 4, negative 2
pacedSpeech: First, multiply each entry of row   2
. The result is   the 2 by 3 matrix row 1 6, negative 4, 3 row 2 negative 6, 4, negative 2

title: Second Step
text: Then, add each entry of row $$1$$ to the entry in the same column of row $$2$$. (Row $$1$$, meanwhile, remains unchanged.) The answer is $$\begin{bmatrix} 6 & -4 & 3 \\ 0 & 0 & 1 \end{bmatrix}$$
speech: Then, add each entry of row  1  to the entry in the same column of row  2 . (Row  1 , meanwhile, remains unchanged.) The answer is  the 2 by 3 matrix row 1 6, negative 4, 3 row 2 0, 0, 1
pacedSpeech: Then, add each entry of row   1
to the entry in the same column of row   2
, meanwhile, remains unchanged.) The answer is   the 2 by 3 matrix row 1 6, negative 4, 3 row 2 0, 0, 1
